attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have previously petitioned on this subject, but felt I made too many points and my main point was lost.

My apologiies and thanks to: 
Alan Rigby
Robin Dixon
Adrian Godfrey
who all kindly signed my previous petition.

May I say firstly there is a great petition set up by Chris Dryden re:'Taxing per family rather than per individual',I agree with this wholeheartedly.

My petition/request to the chancellor is for 'Joint Tax Allowance.' 
I gave up work 6 years ago to care for our growing family full time. I TOTALLY AGREE with all those who said, that was 'my/our choice' and we shouldn't expect any futher help finacially - fair point.

My petition is actually regarding 'my tax allowance' I want to ask the chancellor to consider joining 'our tax allownace' as a family unit.

It seems unfair to penalise a single income family by taxing them 40% after they earn £33.000 yet a family where two are earning can earn £66.000 and still be taxed on the lower rate of 22% - please consider my request to add my tax allowance to my husbands tax allownace - please!

Thank you in advance for your support.
Vera Hull
